intro: Anchusa moltkioides, commonly known as the Turkish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy, bell-shaped blooms from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Anchusa moltkioides is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
